clinical_study.brief_title: CardioFocus vs. Contact Force Guided Pulmonary Vein Isolation in Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: CardioFocus vs. Contact Force Guided Pulmonary Vein Isolation in Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to compare the acute procedure and safety outcomes as well as long term clinical outcomes of 2 groups of patients treated with the HeartLight® Endoscopically Guided Laser Ablation (EGLA) or a commercially available Contact Force Sensing Irrigated Radiofrequency (RF) Ablation Catheter plus, at the operator's discretion, 3D Electroanatomical Mapping (EAM) for the treatment of Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation (PAF).

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from symptomatic, recurrent atrial fibrillation (AF) off of anti-arrhythmic drugs
primary_outcome.description: Recurrent AF is defined as any documented episode of AF lasting more than 30 seconds after a blanking period of 90 days post procedure

secondary_outcome.description: Confirmation of electrical isolation with a circular mapping catheter

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From procedure to 12 months post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: E.g. major bleeding requiring intervention, phrenic nerve palsy, pericardial tamponade, thrombo-embolic events, pulmonary vein (PV) -stenosis, atrial-to-esophageal fistula, death

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from symptomatic, recurrent Atrial Tachy Arrhythmia (ATA) off of anti-arrhythmic drugs
secondary_outcome.description: Recurrent ATA is defined as any documented episode of ATA lasting more than 30 seconds after a blanking period of 90 days post procedure

arm_group.description: Participants will be treated with the endoscopically guided laser ablation catheter

arm_group.arm_group_label: Contact Force Sensing Irrigated RF ablation
arm_group.description: Participants will be treated with a contact force sensing irrigated radiofrequency ablation catheter

intervention.arm_group_label: Contact Force Sensing Irrigated RF ablation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient must not have undergone a previous ablation for the treatment of PAF
- AF Type - Diagnosed with symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (PAF) where PAF is defined as recurrent (two or more) episodes of AF that terminate spontaneously in less than seven days, usually less than 48 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Atrial fibrillation secondary to a reversible cause or of non-cardiac origin
- Diagnosed with persistent atrial fibrillation defined as recurrent episodes lasting more than 7 and less than 365 days
- More than 4 electrical cardioversions in the year prior to enrollment but not including cardioversions performed within 48 hours of arrhythmia onset
- Documented left atrial thrombus on imaging
- Cannot be removed from anti-arrhythmic drugs for other reasons than atrial fibrillation
- New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional Class III or Class IV heart failure
- Left ventricular ejection fraction < 30%
- Left atrial size > 55 mm as measured in the parasternal antero-posterior view
- Myocardial infarction within 60 days prior to enrolment
- Woman of childbearing potential who is pregnant, lactating or not using adequate birth control
